thread.title: Olivia Newton-John’s daughter Chloe Lattanzi says sorry for saying fuck during thank you speech
thread.title_full: Olivia Newton-John’s daughter Chloe Lattanzi says sorry for saying fuck during thank you speech | DailyTelegraph

author: dailytelegraph.com
title: Olivia Newton-John’s daughter Chloe Lattanzi says sorry for saying fuck during thank you speech
text:
OLIVIA Newton-John’s daughter Chloe Lattanzi has apologised for dropping the F-bomb in a message posted online.
The 29-year-old was thanking her fans after the mother-daughter duo’s song You Have To Believe ranked on the charts in the top ten.
She said she wasn’t used to the fame.
Chloe Lattanzi now. Flashback... Chloe Lattanzi A shorter version of the video message remains on Lattanzi’s Instagram page, however the original has been removed.
“I wanted to make a public apology for using the f word in the thank you video to everyone,” she wrote on Instagram.
Olivia and Chloe's You Have to Believe “I hear I offended some people, and funnily enough after I did the video I wanted to redo it. But my mom was in a rush to catch a plane, and I didn’t wanna waste her time.
Other Stories The horror of MH17’s final 90 seconds News 0 comments Who were Playboy’s Aussie stars? Sydney Confidential 0 comments Terror threats: ‘Thousands will die’ National Chloe: I’m not used to the fame Sydney Confidential 0 comments Knights sign half, Raiders re-sign centre Nrl 0 comments Esquire names the sexiest woman alive Books 0 comments Take two... Olivia and Chloe say thank you “I’m human just like you, and make mistakes! I have a habit of swearing when I’m nervous. You may not know it but I’m very shy and self conscious on camera and sometimes forget how normal people talk.”
Lattanzi said her original video was cringeworthy.
Olivia Newton John and daughter Chloe Lattanzi “Anyway, I truly am sorry and was cringing at myself when I watched the video back,” she said.
“This whole fame thing is hard. I say one word then I can’t sleep cuz (sic) I worry I will lose all the wonderful people who have supported me.
Chloe Lattanzi “I’m not a bad girl. I have a good heart with a dirty mouth.
“From the bottom of my heart I am sorry. And I didn’t like the way it sounded either. Oh god I’m ranting. I love you all. And again I’m sorry.
“Slapping myself in the forehead.”
Chloe Lattanzi
